title: [auth2.zomato.com] Reflected XSS at `oauth2/fallbacks/error` | ORY Hydra an OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect Provider

profile.name: Zomato
profile.about: The fastest way to search for great places to eat at and order from around you. Serving 24 countries worldwide.

vulnerability_information:
Heyy there,
I have found a xss in auth2.zomato.com

**Full url:**https://auth2.zomato.com/oauth2/fallbacks/error?error=xss&error_description=xss&error_hint=xss
**Vulnerable Parameters:** All available parameters are vulnerable
**XSS Payload:** `<marquee loop%3d1 width%3d0 onfinish%3dco\u006efirm(document.cookie)>XSS<%2fmarquee>`

**Steps To Reproduce the xss**
Just copy paste and load this url in your firefox browser and tadaa you will get the xss popup
`https://auth2.zomato.com/oauth2/fallbacks/error?error=xss&error_description=xsssy&error_hint=%3Cmarquee%20loop%3d1%20width%3d0%20onfinish%3dco\u006efirm(document.cookie)%3EXSS%3C%2fmarquee%3E`

**POC:**
{F386017}

## Impact

An attacker can send this url with payload to an already  login user and can steal the cookie.

Thankyou
Kind Regards
Sudhanshu

activities.message:
Hi @sudi,

Thank you for your submission. We are investigating your report, and will let you know if we have any questions. We appreciate your assistance and cooperation.

Prateek

Hi, this is patched now in the upstream OSS project ( https://github.com/ory/hydra ) with patch ( https://github.com/ory/hydra/commit/9b5bbd48a72096930af08402c5e07fce7dd770f3 ) and is already released. Announcement will follow later today. We recommend setting a custom error reporting endpoint!

@sudi - This has been fixed now, thanks for helping us keep @zomato and [ORY Hydra] (https://github.com/ory/hydra/) secure :)

More information - There was a vulnerability in [ORY Hydra] (https://github.com/ory/hydra/) an OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect Provider which we use for authentication on one of our services.

We got in touch with the maintainers of [ORY Hydra] (https://github.com/ory/hydra/) and @aeneasr_ quickly mitigated the issue :) Thanks to him for quick response and resolution.

@sudi - We will move this to resolved once we have redeployed the latest version.

Also, do let @aeneasr_ know, how you would like your name to appear on their newsletter which they would be sending out as an announcement to their customers.

Thanks again!

Prateek

additional_data.new_title: [auth2.zomato.com] Reflected XSS at `oauth2/fallbacks/error` | ORY Hydra an OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect Provider

activities.message:
Thankyou so you much for the bounty and your awesome support @prateek_0490-zomato  bhaiya and @aeneasr_
And kindly use my full name **Sudhanshu Rajbhar**  in your newsletter.
Last I want to ask @aeneasr_  can you assign a CVE for this?

Kind Regards
Sudhanshu

Hi Sudhanshu,

ok we'll add the full name!

We're not tracking CVEs yet as the software is pre-release (currently in beta/release candidate) but will start tracking CVEs with stable.

Sure, please notify me when the newsletter is ready.So that I can also have a look at it :)
Thanks again

Hi @sudi, This is now fixed. Can you please check and confirm?

Thanks for helping us keep @zomato secure.

Prateek

Yes I can confirm that the xss is no more reproducible.
Hey @prateek_0490-zomato  it's  my birthday today and this report is going to  be my first disclosed report ,it's like a bday present for me.Thanks a lot

Kind Regards
Sudhanshu
Hey @prateek_0490-zomato, how long will it take :)?

Hey @sudi, apologies for the delay. Disclosing it now.

Prateek
